title: One-Pan Roasted Sausage and Root Vegetables
description: A simple and flavorful meal with sausage and seasonal root vegetables roasted together.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Cut sausage into 1-inch pieces.
On a large baking sheet, toss sausage, sweet potatoes, carrots, and onion with olive oil, salt, pepper, and desired herbs (like rosemary or thyme).
Spread everything in a single layer.
Roast for 35-45 minutes, flipping halfway through, until vegetables are tender and sausage is browned.

title: One-Pot Greek Lemon Chicken and Orzo
description: A bright and flavorful dish with chicken, orzo pasta, and Greek seasonings.

instructions.text: Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces, season with salt, pepper, oregano.
Sear chicken in a large pot or Dutch oven until lightly browned. Remove chicken.
Add garlic, sauté briefly. Add orzo, toast for 1 minute.
Stir in chicken broth and lemon juice. Bring to a boil.
Return chicken to the pot. Reduce heat, cover, simmer until orzo is cooked and liquid is mostly absorbed (about 15-20 mins).
Stir in spinach until wilted. Top with feta cheese before serving.

title: One-Pan Spanish Chicken and Rice (Arroz con Pollo)
description: A simplified version of the classic Spanish dish, cooked in one pan.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Season chicken thighs. Sear skin-side down in an oven-safe skillet until crispy. Remove chicken.
Sauté onion and bell pepper in the same skillet.
Add garlic, paprika, rice. Toast rice briefly.
Stir in broth (infused with saffron if using), diced tomatoes, peas. Bring to a simmer.
Nestle chicken thighs back into the rice mixture. Transfer skillet to oven, bake covered for 20 mins, then uncovered for 15-20 mins until rice is cooked and chicken is done.

title: One-Pot Jambalaya
description: A flavorful Creole rice dish with sausage, chicken (optional), and shrimp cooked together.

ingredients.name: Onion, Celery, Bell Pepper (Holy Trinity, Chopped)

instructions.text: Brown sausage (and chicken if using) in a large Dutch oven. Remove meat.
Sauté onion, celery, and bell pepper until softened.
Add garlic, Cajun/Creole seasoning, rice. Toast rice.
Stir in broth, diced tomatoes, Worcestershire sauce, hot sauce. Return sausage/chicken to pot.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover, simmer for 20-25 minutes until rice is almost cooked.
Stir in shrimp, cover, cook for another 5-7 minutes until shrimp are pink and cooked through. Fluff rice before serving.

title: One-Pot Mushroom Stroganoff
description: A creamy, savory mushroom and noodle dish cooked in a single pot.

instructions.text: Sauté mushrooms and onions in butter or oil in a large pot until browned and softened.
Add garlic, paprika, thyme. Cook for 1 minute.
Stir in vegetable broth, Dijon mustard, Worcestershire sauce (optional), salt, pepper, and egg noodles.
Bring to a simmer, cover, cook until noodles are tender (about 10-12 minutes), stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat. Stir in sour cream or Greek yogurt and fresh parsley.
